content: The U.S. EPA proposed to repeal the controversial Clean Power Plan (CPP) in October 2017. The CPP aimed to limit CO2 emissions from fossil-fuel-fired power plants but faced legal challenges and has not been implemented. Disagreements revolve around the rule's legal basis, design, and cost-benefit analysis.
